            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Five Watersheds Project, formally known as "Rehabilitating and Restoring Unique Landscapes within Five Watersheds along the Bay of Fundy, Nova Scotia, Canada"  is a multi-year Coastal Restoration Fund Project – a program component of the multi-year Oceans Protection Plan (OPP), of the Government of Canada.

The five-year project will address issues of coastal erosion and physical barriers to fish passage in the (1) Chiganois, (2) Debert, (3) Folly, (4) Great Village, and (5) Portapique Watersheds (the Watersheds), within the Cobequid Bay of the Inner Bay of Fundy in Nova Scotia. From that information, the Project will identify areas of habitat concern and create a restoration plan with a focus to ameliorate fish passage barriers caused by aboiteaux, degraded culverts, and erosion.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

fr: Rivières de la baie de Fundy

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-knc1-7690
notes:
The Five Watersheds Project, formally known as "Rehabilitating and Restoring Unique Landscapes within Five Watersheds along the Bay of Fundy, Nova Scotia, Canada"  is a multi-year Coastal Restoration Fund Project – a program component of the multi-year Oceans Protection Plan (OPP), of the Government of Canada.

The five-year project will address issues of coastal erosion and physical barriers to fish passage in the (1) Chiganois, (2) Debert, (3) Folly, (4) Great Village, and (5) Portapique Watersheds (the Watersheds), within the Cobequid Bay of the Inner Bay of Fundy in Nova Scotia. From that information, the Project will identify areas of habitat concern and create a restoration plan with a focus to ameliorate fish passage barriers caused by aboiteaux, degraded culverts, and erosion.

notes_translated.en:
The Five Watersheds Project, formally known as "Rehabilitating and Restoring Unique Landscapes within Five Watersheds along the Bay of Fundy, Nova Scotia, Canada"  is a multi-year Coastal Restoration Fund Project – a program component of the multi-year Oceans Protection Plan (OPP), of the Government of Canada.

The five-year project will address issues of coastal erosion and physical barriers to fish passage in the (1) Chiganois, (2) Debert, (3) Folly, (4) Great Village, and (5) Portapique Watersheds (the Watersheds), within the Cobequid Bay of the Inner Bay of Fundy in Nova Scotia. From that information, the Project will identify areas of habitat concern and create a restoration plan with a focus to ameliorate fish passage barriers caused by aboiteaux, degraded culverts, and erosion.
notes_translated.fr:
Le projet des cinq bassins versants, officiellement connu sous le nom de « Réhabilitation et restauration de paysages uniques dans cinq bassins versants le long de la baie de Fundy, en Nouvelle-Écosse, au Canada », est un projet pluriannuel du Fonds pour la restauration côtière, une composante du Plan pluriannuel de protection des océans (OPP) du gouvernement du Canada.

Le projet quinquennal abordera les problèmes liés à l'érosion côtière et aux obstacles physiques au passage des poissons dans les bassins versants (1) Chiganois, (2) Debert, (3) Folly, (4) Great Village et (5) Portapique (les bassins versants), dans la baie Cobequid de la baie intérieure de Fundy en Nouvelle-Écosse. À partir de ces informations, le projet identifiera les zones préoccupantes en matière d'habitat et créera un plan de restauration visant à améliorer les obstacles au passage des poissons causés par les aboiteaux, les ponceaux dégradés et l'érosion.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.
